comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: She was the actress Beatrice "Minnie" Ashley, 1878-1946 (broadway.cas.sc.edu/content/minnie-ashley). In 1903, she married William Astor Chanler (June 11, 1867 – March 4, 1934), soldier, explorer, and U.S. Representative from New York, third son of John Winthrop Chanler of the Dudley–Winthrop family and Margaret Astor Ward of the Astor family. "They had two sons, William Astor Chanler, Jr. and Sidney Ashley Chanler, before separating amicably in 1909. William Astor Chanler, Jr. (1904–2002) was a published historian. Sidney Ashley Chanler (1907–1994) was a public relations executive who married Princess Maria Antonia of Braganza, daughter of the Duke of Braganza and Princess Elisabeth of Thurn and Taxis, in 1934." (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_A._Chanler). Another photo of her and her sons is in the El Paso herald., July 02, 1918, HOME EDITION, Page 8 (the sons called William and Ashley). At that time, she was president of the French Heroes Fund. In the Bisbee daily review., February 01, 1914, Page 3 (with photo), she was labeled as one of the best sculptresses of the day.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Wikipedia leaves out mention of Theodore Chanler, another Chanler named as pictured here, who appeared in New York among "children of society" in a patriotic pageant along with William and Ashley in 1915. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0D17FF355B1373... This may be Theodore Ward Chandler (1902-1961), music teacher and composer, "one of 8 children of well to do parents". However, the biographical entry says he was the youngest of the 8. books.google.com/books?id=m3S7PIxe0mwC&pg=PA1321&... And this book mentions that T.W. Chanler was the son of Winthrop Astor Chanler, not William Astor Chanler (his brother). Too many Astors and too many Chanlers! books.google.com/books?id=F3hrfQtAVeYC&pg=PP68&dq... Theodore Ward Chandler was the namesake and godson of Theodore Roosevelt, who attended his christening: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F20813FE3F5F12738... In any event, this picture would not seem to be from 1916, as dated, given the birth dates of all the junior Chanlers in question. Given the pose of the portrait, I think the picture is of Sidney Ashley Chanler, not cousin Theodore.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Here are pictures of William and Theodore in that pageant: chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn84026749/1915-03-06/ed-... chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030272/1915-04-11/ed-...

comment.author: 35075914@N06
comment._content: We'll add "Minnie" and leave the boys alone, for now.
